intro: Aulacospermum schischkinii, commonly known as the Schischkin's aulacospermum, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant produces distinctive seed capsules that are often used in traditional Chinese medicine. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and herb collections.
